intro: Eriospermum minutiflorum, commonly known as the small-flowered eriosperm, is a flowering plant native to South Africa. It belongs to the family Asteraceae, which includes daisies and sunflowers, and is characterized by its composite flower heads. The plant has narrow, grass-like leaves and produces small, yellow flowers that bloom in spring. It is typically found in rocky or sandy soils and thrives in full sun. Due to its unique appearance and limited distribution, it is considered a rare and ecologically significant species.
